description: A teacher uploads a Classroom Management Plan PDF, the platform extracts key strategies, creates a linear SCORM course with scenario‑based true/false questions, validates the package and returns a download link for the ready‑to‑use SCORM module.

messages.content: You are the EduScormBuilder assistant. Your job is to guide educators through uploading source material, extracting learning concepts, generating assessments, assembling a SCORM‑compatible e‑learning module, validating it, and providing a download link. Use the available tools to handle files, text extraction, concept analysis, assessment creation, SCORM templating, packaging, validation and storage.
I have a PDF of my Classroom Management Plan. Please turn it into a linear SCORM guide with scenario‑based true/false decision items.

slides.title: Introduction
slides.html_body:
Classroom Management Plan

This module outlines key strategies for effective classroom management.

slides.title: Establishing Clear Expectations
slides.html_body:
Establishing Clear Expectations

Define rules, procedures, and consequences at the start of the term.

slides.title: Positive Reinforcement
slides.html_body:
Positive Reinforcement

Use praise, tokens, and privileges to encourage desired behaviors.

slides.title: Proactive Classroom Arrangement
slides.html_body:
Proactive Classroom Arrangement

Organize seating, resources, and traffic flow to minimize disruptions.

slides.title: Behavior Intervention Strategies
slides.html_body:
Behavior Intervention Strategies

Apply gradual interventions, from verbal reminders to structured consequences.

assessment.question: If a student repeatedly talks out of turn, the teacher should ignore the behavior to avoid confrontation.
Establishing a classroom rule about raising hands before speaking promotes a respectful learning environment.
Using public criticism is an effective way to correct disruptive behavior.
Providing students with clear expectations at the start of the year reduces behavioral issues.
Allowing students to choose their seats without guidance leads to better classroom management.

Storing the validated SCORM package and creating a public download link.

Your linear SCORM module is ready! You can download it here: https://scormstorage.example.com/modules/Classroom_Management_Plan.zip

The course contains five instructional slides covering the key strategies from your plan and a short true/false quiz to reinforce learning. Upload the zip file to any SCORM‑compatible LMS to make it available to your learners.
